dmca.title: Trademark infringement
dmca.body:
t

  _____  

From: Carol Hannasch [mailto:Carol.Hannasch@gia.edu] 
Sent: Thursday, April 06, 2006 4:10 PM
To: legal-response@theplanet.com
Subject: Trademark infringement 



Dear Sirs:

 

It is our understanding that www.dotcomconcepts.com
<http://www.dotcomconcepts.com/>  is hosting the site, www.dyjewels.com
<http://www.dyjewels.com/> , and that you are the parent host provider. The
attached letter was sent via certified mail and by email to Dy Jewels due to
its continued and unauthorized display of a trademarked logo owned by the
Gemological Institute of America, Inc. 

 

It is our hope that Dy Jewels will immediately cease the unauthorized use of
the logo and the GIA name. However, in the event that Dy Jewels continues to
infringe on GIA's trademarks, we would appreciate your assistance in
ensuring compliance by Dy Jewels. Please know that as the host provider,
continued use of GIA's trademark on the dyjewels.com website may also
subject you to legal action.

 

Your understanding of and cooperation with our request will be greatly
appreciated. Please contact me if you need further information or if you
have any questions.

 

Sincerely,

William K. Dix

______________________________________________

William K. Dix

Counsel

Gemological Institute of America (GIA)

The Robert Mouawad Campus

5345 Armada Drive

Carlsbad, California 92008

Tel: 760-603-4089

Fax: 760-603-4439

E-mail: ken.dix@gia.edu

www.gia.edu <http://www.gia.edu/>  

 

The World's Foremost Authority in Gemology T

Ensuring the Public Trust through Nonprofit Service since 1931.

 

This e-mail and any files transmitted with it are confidential and intended
solely for the use of the individual or entity to which they are addressed.
If you have received this e-mail in error, please immediately delete it.
Note that any views or opinions presented in this e-mail are solely those of
the author and do not necessarily represent those of GIA. GIA takes every
precaution to protect e-mail recipients, but recipients are responsible for
checking any e-mail and attachments for the presence of viruses. GIA accepts
no liability for any damage caused by any virus transmitted by this e-mail.
